messages.message: I figured as much. Though you have to tell me how to convinced France and England to be stalwart allies all match long. When ever I messaged France about helping me, he would just say "He is my ally and I need to focus on Italy"
It's called diplomacy. I may elaborate later, but I am far from victory, so I can not just give out information.
A Bud to Ser ~N~ A Tus to Vie ~N~ A Tri s tus to vie ~N~ F to Gulf Lyon ~N~ A suport Trieste
or I could support you into Naples then you mw into Rome??
Please bounce Greece
okay, that's fine.
But i don't understand: do you want Naples?
As it stands as of 29 hours to go: ~N~ F Ionian M Naples ~N~ F Aegean M Greece ~N~ ~N~ Rumania is moving North.
You can have naples this turn I'll take Rome next
very good
expect Germany to begin moving down your flank within the next couple of moves. England has allied himself with Germany.
Thoughts for this next turn?

Yes, I have a big smile on my face this AM and now with the destroyed units from Russia, things look great.
I think you need to take MUN to SIL and RUHR to MUN and or Berlin to SIL with Kiel to Berlin, DEN to Kiel and HAL to DEN. I will move the Nor to Barents and North Sea to Nor SEA with the EC to the North Sea, only if you support that move to the North Sea. Let me know your thoughts?
OK. I will move Mun - Sil and Ruh - Mun, can you support the Ruh - Mun portion? I can support your move back into Nth in the Fall.
I will support you into MUN from RUHR.

Russia tells me he's falling back, I just laughed at him. Not sure he will screw up 3 turns in a row (last turn, his destroys, and this turn). We need to get your fleets positioned to take out the Baltic Sea. Not sure when, but he will loose at least 1-2 Sc's and hopefully he destroys a fleet up here. At least we can hope he does.
He tells me the same thing, "folding" back...like you I have been surprised with his decisions. Agree that I need to get into the Baltic and push through into the center.
Cancel the support into Mun. I am going to try and rotate things a bit more up north, so Berlin will move to Sil.
OK, I will change that to a support MUN instead.
Thanks!
NP, this has been fun thus far.

Absolutely. No Cds to speak of and your negotitations which led to a game altering stab--just what a games supposed to be. OK, Russia's bonehead taking of Ven to stop Turkey cold may have played into it as well, but I have to admit that I sometimes find myself getting lazy about writing the "bad guys" once alliances have become so public and obvious. I generally make a commitment to the end and figure the other side will as well. This one just goes to show me...
Suggestions??

Ehm, i guess at this point it should be possible to just bug Austria in your home regions, CON should be possible if supported from ANK. He can realistically only attack Ankara, unless he's holding. Your fleet then should be able to cross into AEG, since his fleet will be distracted by Italy. I'll move my fleet to Black Sea, even if ANK is attacked you can still get it back the next turn then.
See how I helped you by bouncing, so it still looks like I am attacking you. But in reality, I am with you: "Death to Germany"!!!
It's weird, you should have told me that... but it's ok, it worked anyway :)
I had hoped we could work together for a few more turns.

i am afraid you are coop with the Russian against the german.
I hope not.
he is in big trouble. If you promise me you won't attack him i will withdraw my armies starting the next turn.
hope you understand.
it doesnt matter if it doesnt work ill take it with england support
later on
....your right ill just go on the defensive
ok, I'll support bud-rom
No problem! I do my best not to take /anything/ in diplomacy personally, but I especially don't take busy people's lives personally. Thanks for letting me know, though.

How do you want to handle this turn? I was thinking if we can have you pop a fleet, I could rebuild it in con and get into bs without warning that way, maybe? Haven't considered it in too much depth. Plus an army build to go to arm, and should be pretty good. Or maybe something else?

If things were merely busy, I guess I could handle press as usual. I'd say things are unrealistically complicated - not sure where you're from, but from where I am, the way the whole covid-19 things is being handled is simply surreal, to add a bit to other ongoing issues.

By popping a fleet you mean arranging for the disbanding of one of your fleets?

This sort of thing could be great, and seeing you overtake Russia would be a major improvement to the board as a whole.

Yet, due to sleepiness, I'll again delay any serious commitment at least until tomorrow.
If you need a pause feel free to ask for one, gold has been really good about them and I don't think any of us would mind. I know I've gone over the supposed 2 day limit in other rounds.

I didn't know I could possibly go past the two days... I've already asked for my two days. In any case, as we're dealing with some previously unforeseen major relationship issues, I assume my distress will be longer than any reasonable pause. Besides, despite it being difficult to force myself to actually focus around here, I find it beneficial to have at least this obligation, work and university being halted by covid.

Thanks for the tip, though!

Apart from re-asking the questions about disbanding one of our fleets, and encouraging you again to take advantage of Russia's collapse, I wonder how you see the game developing in the next few years!

Sorry, yesterday turned out pretty busy.

Sorry to hear about your relationship, I know it's been a tough time for a lot of partnerships lately but I'd still rather that have stayed an abstract for you.

As for the game, yes, popping a fleet I meant disbanding one of mine as you head west so that I can rebuild it next to bs. I'm not really sure where the game is headed to be honest, this hasn't been my best round but life has conspired to out it on the back burner a bit, and so combined with not having many people besides you talking a lot, I'll admit I've been giving it less focus than I'd like. I don't think that either of us will do well if we commit to fighting, though, so I'm hoping to see you head west to take advantage of England and Germany's squabble before they make peace. Germany won't be able to make meaningful progress on his own, so you should be able to cut a sweetheart deal for your fleets against England with him I'd think. Meanwhile, a concrete signal of you actually backing off and sending units against another power would enable me to do the same and turn north. I'd expect we'd be able to eventually finish off one or the other of Germany and England and probably bog down at a 3wd after that, unless you want to try and push for a 2wd which I'd be ok with trying since as I said you're the only one really talking and I've enjoyed the communication. If the tournament is going well for you, or you want to optimize our scoring, I think I'd even be ok with us getting to the end and flipping a coin or whoever has the most points from other rounds or something, and giving that person the solo.

That was a long message, sorry more rambling than I'd intended. How do you see the game developing?
i will need your support to take back berlin next turn

I'm awfully sorry about that, but I had a sudden change of heart. Somehow, it seemed you would take the opportunity of being in Ion to cripple me. It makes me feel slightly better that, even though you announced the move to Aeg, it doesn't seem as if you were actually considering a move on Russia in the foreseeable future, which was part of the base assumptions of our partnership. Doesn't mean we're even, but should be taken into account as well.

Sorry I thought I replied to this last night hit I must have left it for the morning and then forgotten I hadn't yet.

For what it's worth, and I know talk is cheap, but I really wouldn't have, I'm more worried about the west. And sorry to have given that impression, what made you think so? I ask just for my own growth as a communicator, since I genuinely was planning to move north this spring if you built an army, and this fall if you hadn't stabbed. But I had a feeling you were not planning on moving to tri, which is why I told myself I'd wait till fall and did the late change to aegean.

I still think us working together is the vastly preferable outcome, and am worried about the west. Is there any way to convince you, and to have you go for tri this season? No reason we can't still fulfill the plan.
But not hit& a weird [797803].

I'm not sure what I'd pick. Maybe it was just intuition, or paranoia. I'm certainly unable to pick a fault on your communication overall, though I can understand why you may have felt some weird vibes, as I'm not exactly a good liar.

Well... Firstly, I appreciate your kind stance, and assume you accept my apologies, this being an integral part of the game. That said, especially considering how it is easier and pleasanter to communicate with you than with anyone else around here (and by a very large margin), I'll give your question some thought and get back to you in the morning. I'm way too tired right now (covid has destroyed any sleep pattern I might once have had) to make such a call.
Oh, yes I guess I didn't explicitly say it. Apology accepted, and very much no harm no foul, if you want to set this past phase aside between the two of us.
Any update?

I again appreciate the kindness.


Unfortunately, no, I could hardly look at the game, let alone give it deep consideration. I hope this season does not bring great change (as, in reality, seems likely), so that considerations next Spring are not much different.
Fair enough! If you'd like to just hold ionian, we can remain where we are for the phase.

Yes, London is yours. I'd prefer you build an army rather than a fleet in Berlin, as that was part of the agreement. No more than the two German fleet already in existence. they are sufficient to keep me out of your territory but not enough for you to mount an effective flanking manuever around England's remnants.

I am okay with leaving England as a DMZ and gaining sc's as you attack Russia. That will take me sailing northward as far as the north Sea and I'll need a secure hold on my territorial waters lend the fleets to help you. If you sail northward in the Bal & Gob and I sail northward around through the Norw. Sea and Barents then we can both bring forces to bear on Russia with little fear.
I'm moving Edi to Nth supt by den. I still wrory about your fleet on Edi, so maybe we trade back edi for Bel so you can move against Rus. Thoughts.

Why support a move into the North Sea? You can just slide down to York and I can support you into London next turn. It would take a lot of talking to get me give up Belgium as it has a strategic value in keeping the troops supported well on the [561374] Front. Any move on my part to take Edinburgh will be telegraphed and you can bounce me out of it. If I'm opposed to you taking London you won't get it anyway because you only have one fleet out there and need my support in.

I thought the move to Nth would be useful in the move on the Russians when the time came. I need to supt myself because the Eng can move to Nth and bounce. If I trusted the Russians, I'd move Den to Nth and edi to yor, but this way I keep the nth out of eng hands. I wasn't expecting you to oppose the move to nth, onlythe eng. My thought was you'd move nor to [743039] if you were heading at the russsians, or hold liv and move brest that direction.
I meant Lvp to [743039](better to hold it in liv) not nor to [743039].

Well it works either way. I'm not too worried about the North Sea as it's not really a hot spot for me but would be for you. He might be able to screw you either way if he guesses right and ends up one of you in York and the other in the North Sea. He should know he can't keep London so why not try for Edinburgh? It's still a crap shoot and wouldn't do anything but keep him alive for another turn or so.
I agree. He does have the fear that leaving Lon will lose it. who knows. anyway, glad we're together.
As you wish, but personally I thought I could still help you later on.
Would you consider getting me ankara?

I hadn't realized it's been more than 3 years since we last communicated. There appears to be a swarm of Turkish fleets headed our way. I just wanted to let you know I'm interested in you holding on to Spain and Marseilles and I'll do what I can to support you there. ~N~ ~N~ In addition, Germany has been taking some liberties with our agreements. If you want to chance moving against him, I might be able to help you retake some territory. (Please don't think I'm definitely promising help against Germany right away, I can't afford to let Turkey and Austria crush him right now.)
Austria and Turkey are allied to move over here, and there is not much way to move against Germany for me
And the person who wins
You've just lost your hold on the med.
Hahaha well now you are just wrong.
Slowly but surely, you will. Perhaps you will frustrate me for a couple years, but after that...we'll just have to see now, won't we?

Actually I feel pretty secure. But even if you can attack me eventually. Whats the point? Even a mild break through for you doesn't equate massive centre gains. Best case scenairio for you is you play second fiddle to Russia.
Yeah. Your French buddie has asked me and Russia for help against Germany. Help which we are willing to give, provided he support us into Venice.

First of all, you probably shouldn't have told me that.

Second, its not in France's interest to take that deal, because Russia is either going to attack you or Germany anyway, so France has nothing to lose by waiting it out.

Third, I don't understand how that makes much of a difference. Don't you see how minor gains in Italy don't stack up to major ones and a massive increase in security to your north. This is all I've ever said.

I am out of position to mount a successful attack against Russia even if I wanted to. You should've been more persuasive when I had a fleet in Black Sea. At least you are doing you're best to hold us back a little bit. That's about all you can do right now.
Its true that you were better positioned to take him then, but you aren't better positioned to attack me. You should just take Budapest and be on your merry way I think.

That isn't good enough, I'm afraid. You can't count on my continued support, on the contrary, you can count on my hostility.

Turkey is a dead man walking. you can kill him either way with very little by way of concerted effort. Austria is your only threat, and one who you can take on head on at the moment. Why not do so?
Because I fear that if I attack Austria, then I lose my only ally, to be faced by an angry Turkey who I've attacked, coupled with a relatively angry Russia...

But at the same time a rational Russia, who realises that he himself has a pretty pissed off Turkey.

My intention in this game is simply to try to get a share in the draw. An alliance with Italy therefore makes alot of sense, because we are next to the stalemate, whilst Turkey is a long way away and so getting the stalemate will be difficult, or require supporting a half dead Italy anyway.

Remember, all I want is what I was saying from the start. I still want it now, because anger has no part in my diplomacy.

Why cut off the support from Venice? If you don't want to grow Turkey to quick You can better not do that (in my opinion). OK if you could win it but that's not the case (for the moment).
If you think you can trust Turkey, dream on ...
Understood, but just one turn ago, you were the beast.
He's hitting Ven from Rome.
I was support holding holland. cant support hold if it has move orders.
You didn't support hold Holland though, you moved to Ruhr.
Well, I'm not so sure about it being your last turn. Italy sure threw a wrench in things, didn't he?
It's hard to tell what is going on in this game. I still expect to be eliminated this turn. I just hope Germany doesn't solo. Good luck!

The more I look at it, the more it doesn't look like a real stab. But who knows?
The main player I don't understand is England.

And I expect that this game will probably end in a three way draw. Its been a good learning experience for me at least. I think Italy supported himself to Con only so that you could then get into Ankara faster.
Cute.
Trieste support Tuscany to Venice please? :)
Is it agreed?
yeah
Didn't think so. So what's your next move?
I didn't think so either.
Support move to buda from rum please
So where do we stand?
I don't think I'm in a position to need giving you bulgaria. You won't accept other options to work together?
Well, between Russia and myself, we could fairly easily overrun you... Why do you prefer that to you and I actually working together?
If Russia attacks me, then I will help Germany take Warsaw.
And I don't htink you could easily overrun me anyhow. Russia will probably lose Kiel, St.p, and Warsaw this turn.
if you move on Russia, then he'd also lose Sevastopol, and I'd support you to Moscow inthe following turn and you can work on northern advancement.
And what guarantee do I have that your newly built fleet won't head for me and kill me instead?

The guarantee is the board itself. I have 2 Italy fleets that are pissed off at me. And 2 French fleets (who will build more) that want into the Ionian and is allied with the English. The best option is to create a stalemate line in the sea against the foreign navies and focus on the land.
Which means, I'm ok with you building fleets so we can ensure we're in a draw, probably with England.
Well then give me Bulgaria so that I can build fleets.

I will support you into Sevastopol. Russia will have 1 center and you'll be without an ally. I'm will help you gain a center and build a fleet and have opportunity for Moscow, Tunis, etc.

If I give you Bulgaria, then I will need to defend many more neighboring centers, and that's just a waste of resources.

well done on the [74197] of greece. ~N~ Where do we go from here? ~N~ ~N~ I was thinking a combination of R/T/F vs G/I ~N~ ~N~ Our DMZ is working fairly well, and I think it should stay in place. We need to discuss the Vie/Tri/Alb problem. I can always offer support, from Budapest if it is needed. ~N~ K

Sounds good - G/I is in the way of both of us, but France isn't in a position to attack Italy right now (and doesn't look to be going after Germany either, unless he suddenly moves Belgium to Holland, Picardy to Belgium, Burgandy to Ruhr, and Marseilles to Burgandy and gets you to hit Berlin to break support of Munich for him). Suggesting to France that he could pick up two centers this turn might get him to bite, and F Mar built at the end of the year would help against Italy. ~N~ ~N~ I think Italy will hold both Trieste and Vienna this turn, so if you support Serbia into Trieste, I'm sure Venice will be holding it so Italy will keep it - is there any way you can move around to occupy Bohemia, Galicia, and Budapest? This would put you in a good position to take Vienna if I hit Trieste with Serbia. I am considering moving Greece to Albania, and Aegean to Greece, forcing Albania to retreat to Adriatic. I'm also considering moving Smyrna out to Eastern Med and hopefully getting into Ionian soon. Not sure if it's worth risking losing Greece and getting it back again next turn, though, since Italy might anticipate and use Ionian to bounce me out of Eastern Med.

France has been hectoring me since the begining of this game to attack germany, now that I have made the first moves I am pretty sure that he'll jump on the chance to prosper from the fall of germany. I will suggest to him however that he also considers moving A Bur - Ruh to place pressure on Munich. ~N~ ~N~ I to am pretty sure Italy will place support on both Vie & Tri this season. I was already considering moving a Gal - Sil, but am thinking seriously about amending this to Gal - Boh. regarding Serbia I would be grateful if you would consider supporting my army budapest - hold. this is just in case Germany's A Vie decides to support A Tri - Bud.

I can hold Budapest. I think you're probably right, although I also wouldn't be surprised if Trieste hits Serbia in order to break support of Greece. But Aegean will support Greece, so Serbia will be free to support the hold.

Hi. Sorry about the whole invasion thing... As you can see I have stabbed Austria, seeing as he wasn't helping me much anyway! ~N~ Obviously as things stand you are missing bits of your homeland to both me and to Austria. I just want you to know that I would like to offer again (genuinely this time) the hand of friendship. You would make a much more practical ally for me because you will soon be able to strike against the main threat in this game, France. I know me and France are on the same number of supply centres, but at the moment he has Italy as an ally and only tiny fragments of Germany and England resisting him - I currently have no allies and Russia, Austria and Italy all out to get me! ~N~ So I'm hoping I can do a deal with you to balance things up again. ~N~ So my proposal is: this turn, Moscow support Sev > Ukr, and next turn my Ukr will support Liv > War, and Moscow can move into Sev. Austria won't expect us to ally (particularly if you pretend to ally with him!), and by the next build you will have all your home Sc's back. ~N~ Basically I need your help (Italy is my back-up plan but he's allied with France), otherwise I'm out of this game. And if we work together - either one of us could win. I hope by giving up Sev as a gesture of good faith I can convince you that I mean business. ~N~ Thanks for listening!

I was going to propose you something like that. try to have Austria moving away with GAL so its one less support to take in consideration. ~N~ Also propose him to attack me or something, so you're sure to take UKR.

I'm not sure he'll believe anything I say any more! And he might disband Gal or Ukr in any event. But if they're both still there you might suggest he attacks Rumania with Gal and supports you into Sevastopol with Ukr (I'm sure you can sell it!). You probably won't get Warsaw back this turn with 2 but if you get me into Ukraine to support you, we should get Warsaw back to you before the build. You can choose whether to risk taking it with 2 and take Sevastopol or to make certain of Warsaw with 3 and trust me to let you have Sevastopol next time round - I certainly wouldn't mind having the extra unit for an extra turn!
Well it seems Turkey has decided to turn on me, if you want help re-taking Sevastopol then i am happy to assist. ~N~ 03:15 PM mhmm, I can support you in SEV and you give me back WAR?
This is what we exchanged. But I stick with you.
A wise choice. I can afford to let you have Sevastopol a lot more than Austria can afford to give up Warsaw!
go take belgium :P?
i think hes gonna bounce, im going to ruhr
that works too :)
i think i missed the turn? im sorry, i had an awful night and went to bed really early.

please support kiel - berlin and set your order when you confirm... my position is compromised since i moved against england but germany is still not out of picture, but i hope we can work something out.
please reply, i put my trust in our alliance, if you're not reliable i would like to work with england again
oh i got it - kiel to berlin
thanks! any news about turkey / austria? if they stay allied, it would be very hard to defend your Scs even with my help

no see here is the thing, i had a pact with one to attack the other when it was necessary, but now i sense a bit of hedging. as much as i hate to invite foreigners onto my soil, if you can spare a unit from marseilles in piedmont in case i need to defend venice, that would be lovely...
you know what, never mind that.

sorry, i didn't see your message and mars ended up in bur. you were lucky that austria missed a phase again. if you could wait for a year we could arrange another SC for you in germany? because i would like to build a fleet now
i will build a fleet in mars only to fool england... and i don't want you to turn to the other side of course!
is this ok?
Done.

Can you support TUS-ROM. I will also hit TYR, so VEN should be safe.

I will support you to EDI from YOR?
Yes to both. Anything else?
Why the fleet in Kiel?
I need another fleet to support NS, and have enough armies. Ok, great.
Did I read wrong that you were building an army?

No, you didn't read wrong, that was my intention. I can use this fleet, though, although I'd rather have had an army, especially with Italy building his army in Venice. Can the fleet help you in any way?

No the fleet can't help me in any way. We're looking at the same map, and there only so many fleets can be useful against France. Your build says you are coming at me. I cannot interpret it any other way. Are you implying I should heed France and Russia's request for me to ally with them? I've been playing cat and mouse with them so far, since you've had a knife to my throat with all of the fleets, but now I feel as though I should stick to them instead since your attack on me is inevitable. Please clear my head if my logic is flawed. I'd much rather ride your coattails, but I don't want to be a fool here.
There's a lot to talk about, and I'm writing up a response. I hope to have it to you in an hour or so.

I think you're being fairly reasonable, but you may have overlooked Burgundy; nonetheless, I respect your concern. I'm sure Russia and France would love to use you; you're in a commanding position against France and Russia doesn't have anything to lose, but he's upset I took Norway. I suppose it's unfortunate he Nmrd.

You have the opportunity to grab Denmark, Holland, or Belgium, or even Norway if you can get Russia's help. I trust you, but I know it must be tempting. I'm willing to work around this in a way that is profitable to both of us.

Kiel at the moment can protect Holland and Denmark. I have to think long-term, where I can expand, and what the end-game will look like. I've already explained why I won't assault England; I'd leave myself wide open for Austria and Italy, and even Russia and France. I would have preferred Italy to have built a fleet against France instead of that stupid army against me, and I wish I had built an army instead. Again, sorry. Let's look forward.

I'm pretty sure that Russia's going to support himself into Norway. I know you're nervous about me taking NTH; but if I wanted to, wouldn't I have done it already?

I'd like to make a plan that guarantees you at least one SC by the end of the year--even if it's one of mine--and also keeps us on solid footing against France and Russia. Would you like to draft a plan like that?

I'll only consider a plan with you if you guarantee only 2 fleets bordering the North Sea. Keeping a fleet in Kiel is not a threat to me, and I understand how comforting it can be to Germany... but 4 fleets is a bit overkill.

That's perfect for me. Here's my proposal:

Swe to Fin. Norway hold. Ska to Swe. Kiel & Belgium bounce in Holland. Wal & Lon S NTH to ENG.

This leaves only Norway and Belgium bordering NTH, puts you on the offensive against France, and allows you to protect all your home centers. If you can commit to leaving NTH empty, I can commit to pulling my fleets away.

If you like this plan, I will enter my orders.

Clever. I offered the 2 border fleets as a first step to dmz north sea. I'd rather not give you the option of a juicy retreat. How about nths support hold norway, and london takes EC with wales and belgium support?

Clever. I offered the 2 border fleets as a first step to dmz north sea. I'd rather not give you the option of a juicy retreat. How about nths support hold norway, and london takes EC with wales and belgium support?
That would be fine too.
France is likely to cut Belgium's support, though. Not really a big deal, just something to keep in mind.
I'm going to enter my moves as described.
kk
I'm going to hold norway, and position to cover EDI. I will attack France when you're in a less aggressive stance against me.

i take serbia and thus ends austria....
what about turkey?
he left... we share it and then I understand we go together north... right?
you north i west
yep
for us no to sta each other i think we should clear out the austrian land thus not giving each other a reason to stab
ok i agree
Italy has builds does that mean they have been replaced?
Yup, but notice France is going after Italy now lol?
yeah ha!
Danke, supporting you into Ankara.
Thanks.
Would you like to DMZ Venice/Trieste/Tyrolia? Or does it not really matter to you.
I'm okay with you in [343530].
sure you went into apu
so i could hold venice, whatever, doesn't really matter now does it
not really

You're in a tough spot - what can I do to assist? CON-BUL S by Black might be devastating to Austria if I attack Aegean. You could then help me into GRE. I need a southern friend after Itlay is eliminated. At some point Russia will swing around your eastern flank. Be prepared. Think about my suggestion and let me know.
Actually it would be Black-bul S by CON to make sure Aegean cannot retreat to one of your home Scs.
yeah thats true. i will give it a shot because if you attack me i will be dead either way.
i ll,give you greece
so let me ask you. do you feel that you need to move to tyrolia this turn? can it be postponed for another couple of season? or do you feel you'd feel safer if you moved now?

so it seems England is asking you to support him into MAO. I don't know how useful it is, but it might be.

on a second note... if you are ok with it, I'd like to move to Gas as its important to holding my stalemate line with you down the road, and it will allow me to give you MAO without a problem. I would like to hold this line: F NAO, F Iri, F Ech, U bre/bur sup Gas, A ruh/ki sup mun. what do you think?

Every vibe I'm getting from your recent press is that you will try to solo. An army in Tryolia will not harm you and where to do you plan to go that you can't leave an army behind in Munich? Why are you wanting me to allow England to MAO, so he can help you solo? No I don't want you to move to Gascony, and why on earch would I want you to stalemate me and feel secure, Austria and I cannot stalemate each other, and that fear will force us to not stab each other since if we do then the other will help you solo. If you stalemate me, then you are free to stab Austria in the east and I cannot do anything about it. Yeah, I'm not a fan of anything you've just said, but feel free to expand on your thoughts.

well, thank you for sharing your honest thoughts. I will expand and show you exactly where I think your fear of a German solo is completey misplaced.

I'm at work now, but will do so as soon as I can because its important for me that you understand my reasoning and that i understand yours.

but mark my words. this game will be a 3way, with Germany sitting at 14 at most.

alright. finally some time online.

look italy - here is the gist of things. I am at 11. to get a solo, I need 7 more. what I know is I CAN NOT get that. stp, lvp, lon puts me at 14. where will the other 4 come from? impossible.

with 14 though, I can hold a stalemate line... this one:

NAO/Iri/Ech hold Bre/Bur sup Gas (6 units)
Ruh/Kie sup Mun Bal sup Ber (5 units)
